--- In gladiator@y..., "James Trahern" <4idlamo@i...> wrote:
> The most obnoxious problem I discovered was my teammates inability 
to survive. The game is most fun on Battle, but I always played on 
slaughter. With my brothers and I jamming around the keyboard, we had 
one fighter, one cleric, and one mage. That was it.
> The cleric built up a "base" of sparkles, and the mage and fighter 
ran around, beat people up, then retreated back to the 'base' for 
healing before repeating.
> The comps can't seem to handle anything other than walking against 
the side walls of the map. Sure they respond to "YO!" but only for a 
few seconds.

I would almost wager a thief's taunt is more effective about bringing 
your opponents to you than 'Yo' command does for bringing your own 
teammates to you.
 
> Hire a small team. Try and get them controlled by humans. Or play on 
an easy dif. and get no exp. thats' about it.

That's my point for wanting 'The 50 project'.  50 or so scenarios that 
 can gradually build your team up to the point where each character 
can take care of itself.
